channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Chronically homeless staying housed, but new faces appearing on streets
item.description: People who have been chronically homeless are choosing to stay in permanent housing - some for the first time in more than 20 years.

item.title: Returning Kiwis in managed isolation: 'There is going to be a limit'
item.description: The minister in charge of managed isolation says the government is looking at a booking system for returning New Zealanders.

item.title: Auckland police shooting: Pair charged over death of Matthew Hunt plead not guilty
item.description: Two people charged in relation to the death of police officer Matthew Hunt have pleaded not guilty.

item.title: Study finds back seat drivers can be useful
item.description: A study has revealed that back seat drivers can be useful and even help people to drive more safely.

item.title: Manukau Harbour 'wouldn't work' as new Auckland port
item.description: Manukau Harbour would never work as a new location for Auckland's port, transport company director Chris Carr says.

item.title: Jami-Lee Ross appears in court ahead of electoral fraud trial
item.description: A trial date for former National Party MP Jami-Lee Ross and three businessman has been set.

item.title: Cancer care advocate and widow Melissa Vining hits out at Southern DHB
item.description: Cancer care advocate Melissa Vining says the Southern DHB is denying patients the care they need and deserve.

item.title: Snowfall warnings for South Island roads, high winds forecast for North Island
item.description: Snow is expected to make driving treacherous in some parts of the country today, while high winds are forecast for the upper North Island.

item.title: Covid-19 testing rates drop: 'People can fall into a bit of complacency'
item.description: Doctors are backing government calls to keep doing thousands of Covid-19 tests each day to ensure the community's free of the virus.

item.title: DHB urges government to avoid Queenstown for isolation due to healthcare
item.description: Southern DHB is pushing for Dunedin and Invercargill to be used for managed isolation ahead of Queenstown, due to concerns about its lack of medical facilities.

item.title: National MP Hamish Walker admits leaking Covid-19 patient details
item.description: Acting chief executive of Auckland Rescue Helicopter Trust Michelle Boag has confirmed she gave the patient details to Walker.

item.title: Awatere River strewn with rubbish after flooding into old landfill
item.description: People have been collecting the rubbish from the riverbanks and nearby beaches after the Awatere River cut into the old landfill.

item.title: Air NZ may extend bookings freeze - chief executive Greg Foran
item.description: Air New Zealand is not ruling out extending its three-week freeze on bookings to help with the squeeze on the managed isolation of returning travellers, its chief executive says.

item.title: Renewed call for Key to apologise over 'jihadi brides' claim
item.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says it's not her place to decide if Sir John Key should apologise over false claims brides were leaving New Zealand for ISIS in 2015.

item.title: Hastings Mayor says not enough done to fix risks on State Highway 5
item.description: The Mayor of Hastings says there is a lack of action from the government on the road between Napier and TaupÅ, where eight people have died in the past year.

item.title: Haami Hanara's victim: 'Hand yourself in'
item.description: The former partner of a murder victim is calling for the killer - who is on the run - to hand himself in.

item.title: Two new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand - Minister Hipkins
item.description: The new cases are a woman in her 20s and a woman in her 30s, both from the same family, who arrived 2 July from Afghanistan.

item.title: Labour and NZ First at loggerheads over Auckland port move
item.description: Transport Minister and senior Labour MP Phil Twyford has joined forces with his former colleague and now Auckland Mayor Phil Goff against New Zealand First and the party's push to move the port north.
